How Online Degree Programs Work

Where do I begin?

Students who meet the admission requirements can apply to be directly admitted into a online degree program. These students will start by taking the online orientation course, a one credit course offered every block. This course prepares students to succed online and charts a course to graduation. Pathway students who complete Academic Start do not need to take GS 111.

How long will it take?

Our online degree program allows students the flexibility to finish their degree while balancing a busy life. Students can accelerate to graduation by taking classes all three semesters each year, or take a semester off when needed. Students must complete the program within eight years for a bachelor's or four years for an assoicate's.

What are the classes like?

BYU-Idaho's online courses mirror campus courses. They follow the same semester format and use the learning model. Student will have regular due dates for assignments and should expect to interact with their instructors and peers often.

Will my credits transfer?

BYU-Idaho strives to make the most of your transfer credit while maintaining the integrity of the program. During your orientation class you will work with your advisor to create a graduation plan that maximizes your transfer credits and map out all the courses you need to take to graduate.
